description: President Joe Biden blamed US lawmakers’ failure to approve emergency aid to Ukraine for the fall of Avdiivka, which handed Russia a significant battlefield victory after months of fighting for control of the city.
title: Biden Says Ukrainian City’s Fall Shows the Cost of US Aid Delays

description: The judge who hit Donald Trump and his real estate company with fines expected to exceed $450 million in New York state’s civil fraud trial against the former president made clear in his decision that he doubted testimony of key witnesses, including the billionaire and three of his children.
title: Trump Trial Judge Slams ‘See No Evil, Hear No Evil’ Testimony

description: Ten people have been arrested at a pro-Palestine demonstration in central London.
title: Ten Arrested at Pro-Palestine Demonstration in Central London

description: German arms manufacturer Rheinmetall AG will open a new plant in Ukraine to produce artillery ammunition with a local joint venture partner.
title: Rheinmetall to Set Up Ammunition Plant Joint Venture in Ukraine

description: Germany could increase military spending to as much as 3.5% of economic output as it ramps up investment to reverse years of neglect of the armed forces, according to Defense Minister Boris Pistorius.
title: Germany Says Its Defense Spending Could Increase to 3.5% of GDP

description: Hungary’s parliament could ratify Sweden’s bid to join NATO as early as this month after more than a year’s delay that left the central European nation as the final holdout.
title: Last Holdout Hungary May Vote This Month on Sweden’s NATO Bid

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban called for an overhaul of the country’s child support laws and institutions, in an effort to defuse an escalating political crisis that threatened to erode support for his party.
title: Viktor Orban Aims to Turn Page on Abuse Pardon Scandal

description: Russian authorities have yet to offer a cause for Alexey Navalny’s sudden death, and his family can’t identify where his body is, according to the opposition leader’s spokeswoman.
title: Navalny’s Family Says It Hasn’t Been Given Access to His Body

description: The Democratic Alliance, South Africa’s main opposition party, predicted it can topple the African National Congress in this year’s election and said that it has a plan to end power cuts and turn the struggling economy around within five years if it does.
title: South Africa’s Main Opposition Says Election Victory is in Sight

description: Ecuador plans to reverse a decision to swap decades-old Russian-made weaponry with the US, Moscow’s ambassador to the country, Vladimir Sprinchan, told the state-run news agency RIA Novosti.
title: Russia Claims Ecuador Has Agreed to Cancel Weapons Swap With US

description: Gary Gensler is midway through his tenure leading the US Securities and Exchange Commission through a shakeup of financial markets and middlemen, and amid historic changes in the players and what’s being traded. The SEC Chair has completed just over half of his agenda. Here’s what Gensler has in mind for the rest.
title: For Gensler, Financial Risks Lie Where Banks and Non-Banks Meet

description: The US will send funds obtained from a Russian smuggling ring to Estonia for the benefit of Ukraine, a Justice Department official said Saturday at the Munich Security Conference.
title: US to Send Forfeited Russian Funds to Estonia for Use in Ukraine

description: It seemed like the 2024 equivalent of a Sputnik moment: In a cryptic statement this week, a US lawmaker privy to US intelligence warned of a grave but unspecified security threat from Russia.
title: Russia’s Bid for an Orbiting Nuclear Weapon Highlights a New Space Race

description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba is seeking to meet with Chinese counterpart Wang Yi at the Munich Security Conference on Saturday in an effort to persuade Beijing to participate in a summit to discuss Kyiv’s terms for a just peace with Russia.
title: Ukraine Seeks to Meet China Minister to Discuss Peace Summit

description: Hello from London, where we’re still digesting taking the Suffragette line to Gospel Oak and the Weaver route to White Hart Lane.
title: Election Lessons and Economic Hopes: Saturday UK Briefing

description: Nigeria’s capital inflows fell in 2023 as foreign direct investments and inflows from portfolio investors declined, the West African nation’s statistics agency said.
title: Nigeria’s Capital Inflows Fell 26% in 2023 Amid Economic Turmoil

description: The UK is working with nations including the US to provide Ukraine with thousands of new AI-enabled drones that could swarm Russian targets simultaneously, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: UK, Allies Look to Arm Ukraine With New AI-Enabled Swarm Drones

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy invited Donald Trump to travel with him to the frontlines of Russia’s full-scale invasion of his country so that the former US leader can experience “real war.”
title: Zelenskiy Invites Trump to Experience ‘Real War’ at Frontlines

description: UK Foreign Secretary David Cameron plans to visit the Falkland Islands soon in a show of British sovereignty over the archipelago, after newly-elected Argentine President Javier Milei pledged to “get them back.”
title: UK’s Cameron Plans Falklands Trip to Reject Milei Islands Claim

description: Malaysian anti-graft officials granted one of Mahathir Mohamad’s sons more time to declare his wealth amid an investigation into his business activities.
title: Malaysia Extends Deadline for Mahathir’s Son to Declare Assets

description: Engulfed in a prolonged economic slowdown and facing the prospect of Donald Trump returning to the White House, the European Union is dusting off a plan to unite its disparate capital markets.
title: Lagarde’s Trump Warning Paves Way for EU Capital Markets Drive

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz raised pressure on European allies to increase aid to Ukraine, using a speech at the Munich Security Conference to warn of the political and financial cost of a Russian victory.
title: Scholz Urges European Allies to Step Up Military Aid for Ukraine

description: Beijing called on Washington to lift sanctions and end the harassment of Chinese nationals traveling to the US, a reminder of diplomatic challenges that remain between the two countries even as ties start to warm.
title: China Urges US to Lift ‘Illegal’ Sanctions, Ease Travel Concerns

description: Poland’s government is getting ready to move against central bank governor Adam Glapinski as its campaign to push allies of the previous administration from state institutions gathers momentum.
title: Tusk Is Finalizing His Plan to Try Ousting Poland’s Central Bank Chief

description: The UK Labour Party handed the governing Conservatives two thumping defeats in a pair of special elections on Thursday in a setback for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak that reinforces the sense that the opposition is on course to win power at a general election due in the next year.
title: Labour’s Lead Is Firm, Reform Gains: Five Lessons From UK By-Elections

description: Almost seven years after Sierra Leone’s then-President Ernest Bai Koroma unveiled the African Union’s Silencing the Guns initiative, which sought to end violent conflict on the continent by 2020, peace remains elusive.
title: African Leaders Fall Short on Pledge to Silence the Guns

description: Former Thai leader Thaksin Shinawatra is set to be released from detention on Sunday, Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin said, six months ahead of the end of his prison term after authorities granted him parole citing old age and illness.
title: Former Thai Leader Thaksin Set to Be Released on Sunday, PM Says

description: Ukraine’s military announced it’s withdrawing troops from the embattled eastern city of Avdiivka, near Russian-occupied Donetsk, to avoid them being surrounded and cut off by Moscow’s advancing forces.
title: Ukraine Withdraws From Embattled Avdiivka Under Russian Pressure

description: Donald Trump was banned from doing business in New York for three years and ordered to pay $354 million for lying about his wealth, but one thing missing from the judge’s order was an earlier edict to dissolve all the companies the billionaire owns in the state.
title: Trump Keeps NY Empire Intact as Judge Rescinds Asset-Sale Order
